author: John Cross
title: Arsene Wenger's Arsenal look broken beyond repair with stars squabbling in the dressing-room and fans fighting among themselves
text:
Mirror Sport understands that senior pros believe the uncertainty has become a huge issue, which is threatening to derail their whole season. 
A few weeks ago, players believed Wenger was staying. 
Now most think he is going and his staff do not know for certain either as he always keeps his cards close to his chest. 
Those close to Wenger believe it will be his last season. But it has left players like Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, Jack Wilshere and Kieran Gibbs uncertain over their futures as they have just 18 months left on their deals. 
They are being kept in the dark while Arsenal look to resolve Wenger’s future and the contract situations with Sanchez and Ozil. 
Senior players still hold the Frenchman in the highest regard and respect him as a nice man and good manager. But they simply do not do as much work on tactics or preparation as some other big clubs, and they were horribly exposed by Bayern. Wenger's exit cannot come soon enough for some of his players (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Read More European press hammer feeble Arsenal following second half collapse in Munich 
Even the manager’s most loyal supporter believes it is time for change. 
Arsenal fan Keith Martin, who has a Wenger tattoo on his back, believes the club’s slump is in danger of ruining the Frenchman’s legacy. 
Martin said: “I’ve still got so much respect for the man, but I do think it’s time to call it a day. I don’t want him to be remembered for these last few years at the club. It’s nasty now. 
"He has been magnificent for the club, absolutely amazing. But he should come out now, say he will see out his contract and then everyone will get behind him and the team and give him the send off that he deserves.” 
Wenger’s unwavering loyalty to his players is another major issue. 
He is close to N’Golo Kante’s agent and a deal was there to be done last summer, but he baulked at paying a big commission fee and the fact the France midfielder wanted wages of £200,000-a-week. Kante is well on his way to back-to-back titles, and could have been a Gunner now (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More JOHN CROSS: In 20 years of covering Wenger, I have never seen him like this 
Wenger also feared the arrival of Kante, vital to Leicester's shock title win a year ago, would block Francis Coquelin’s progress. Kante ended up at Chelsea instead, and they now top the Premier League. 
Meanwhile, Arsenal’s big midfield signing of the last off-season, £30m Granit Xhaka is seen as “bang-average” in the eyes of some. 
There is also a feeling that it is far too comfortable at Arsenal’s state-of-the-art training ground. 
They had a players’ meeting after the Chelsea defeat and Mirror Sport understands there was barely a raised voice, just a run-of-the-mill post-match inquest. 
Some players want rollickings and rows to clear the air, but Wenger does not like confrontation. Is the atmosphere at Arsenal's training-ground too light-hearted? (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) Read More EXCLUSIVE — Wenger IS set to leave in the summer following shattering Munich loss 
Arsenal’s recruitment is another area of concern. 
As well as missing out on Kante, they could have signed Roma defender Kostas Manolas for £10m but ended up spending £35m on fellow centre-back Shkodran Mustafi — having had the option to sign him for £10m before he went from Sampdoria to Valencia two years earlier. 
Whoever comes in as the next manager will almost certainly be able to bring in two assistants, but Arsenal will look to introduce an infrastructure which will remain in place irrespective of who is in the hot-seat. 
This feels like the end game for Wenger. 
When change does come it will be big — and some of the Gunners' players believe it cannot come a moment too soon. poll loading What should Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger do? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
